did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Ordinances, maps, reports, correspondence, course outlines, interview tapes and transcript, publications, family and biographical material, income tax returns; and other miscellaneous business and personal papers.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Contains material on Gordon and Brysis Whitnall's careers as planners as well as family and biographical records.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: In 1913, Gordon Whitnall founded the Los Angeles City Planning Association, and in 1920, he established the Los Angeles City Planning Department. From 1920-1930, he was Director of Planning for Los Angeles, and from 1929-1930 was president of the League of California Cities. From 1932-1935 he was the coordinator of the Committee on Government Simplification for Los Angeles County. In 1941, Gordon and Brysis Whitnall established a planning and government consulting firm in Los Angeles. Gordon Whitnall was an instructor in Planning at the University of Southern California, and a member of the American Society of Planning Officials, the American Institute of Planners, the American Society of Consulting Planners, and the International Fraternity of Lambda Alpha, Los Angeles Chapter.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Includes ordinances, maps, reports, and correspondence for cities in the West and Southwest, including Amarillo, Texas; Albuquerque, New Mexico; Seattle, Washington; and Los Angeles, Modesto, Glendale, Palm Springs, and numerous other cities in California. Personal files consist of course outlines; Gordon and Brysis Whitnall interview tapes and transcript; material on Charles B. Whitnall Park; professional society correspondence, publications, and research information concerning the American Institute of Planners, the American Society of Planning Officials, and other organizations; published articles and reports; and tape recording of a speech at Cornell University, "After a Half Century of Urban Zoning - What's the Verdict." Also, family and biographical material; income tax returns; and other miscellaneous business and personal papers.

prefercite.p: Gordon and Brysis Whitnall Papers, #2880. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

arrangement.head: SERIES LIST
arrangement.p:
Series I. Personal Files
Box 11 and 15

Series II. Ordinances, Maps, Reports, and Correspondence (Alpha and Date Files)
Boxes 1-11; 15-22

Series III. Professional Societies: Correspondence, Publications, Research Information
Box 12-13

Series IV. Papers by Gordon Whitnall (a few by others)
Box 14

scopecontent.p: 2 tape recordings, one transcript, trans.??? to appropriate locations
